member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn
member.summary: AgXSAn root interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn.Initialize(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are only accessible after Initialize is called. Initialize optionally performs a Reset and queries the instrument to validate the instrument model.
member.param: An IVI logical name or an instrument specific string that identifies the address of the instrument, such as a VISA resource descriptor string.
Specifies whether to verify the ID of the instrument.
Specifies whether to reset the instrument.

The user can use the OptionsString parameter to specify the initial values of certain IVI inherent attributes for the session. The format of an assignment in the OptionsString parameteris "Name=Value", where Name is one of: RangeCheck, QuerytInstrStatus, Cache, Simulate, RecordCoercions, InterchangeCheck,or DriverSetup. Value is either true or false except for DriverSetup. If the Options String parameter contains an assignment for the Driver Setup attribute, the Initialize function assumes that everything following "DriverSetup=" is part of the assignment.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are not accessible after Close is called.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency
member.summary: IAgXSAnSAFrequency interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.ConfigureStartStop(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This function configures the frequency range of the IviSpecAn using start frequency and stop frequency. If start frequency is equal to the stop frequency, then the spectrum analyzer is in time-domain mode. In auto-coupled mode, resolution bandwidth (RBW), video bandwidth (VBW), and sweep time may be affected by this function.
member.param: Specifies the left edge of frequency domain in Hertz.
Specifies the right edge of frequency domain in Hertz.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.ConfigureCenterSpan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This function configures the frequency range of the IviSpecAn using the center frequency and frequency span. If span corresponds to zero hertz, then the spectrum analyzer is in time-domain. This function modifies the Frequency Start and Frequency Stop attributes as follows:Frequency Start = center frequency - span/2 and Frequency Stop = center frequency + span/2.In auto-coupled mode, RBW, VBW and sweep time may be affected by this function.
member.param: The center frequency of the frequency sweep (in Hertz).
The frequency span of the frequency sweep (in Hertz).

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.FullSpan
member.summary: Sets the analyzer span to full span showing the full frequency range of the analyzer.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.PreviousSpan
member.summary: Sets the analyzer frequency span to the previous span setting.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.Tune
member.summary: Tune causes the analyzer to change Center Frequency to the strongest signal in the tunable span of the analyzer, excluding the LO.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.Start
member.summary: The left edge of frequency domain in Hertz.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.Stop
member.summary: Specifies the right edge of frequency domain in Hertz.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.Offset
member.summary: The frequency offset value to account for frequency conversions outside of the analyzer.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.Center
member.summary: The center frequency.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.CenterStepIncrement
member.summary: The step size for the center frequency and start and stop frequency functions.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.Span
member.summary: The displayed frequency range about the center frequency.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.Synthesis
member.summary: The LO (local oscillator) phase noise behavior that is optimum for measurement accuracy.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.CenterStepAutoEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disable the center frequency step size automatic mode.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.SynthesisAutoEnabled
member.summary: Allows the analyzer to automatically select an LO phase noise behavior that is optimum for the selected span and RBW.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.SpanToResolutionBandwidthRatio
member.summary: The ratio between the span and the resolution bandwidth.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency.SpanToResolutionBandwidthRatioAutoEnabled
member.summary: Enables/Disables the automatic setting up of the ratio between the span and the resolution bandwidth.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel
member.summary: IVI SpecAn class-compliant level interface

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel.Configure(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnAmplitudeUnitsEnum,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: This function configures the vertical attributes of the IviSpecAn.
member.param: Specifies the amplitude units for input, output and display. The driver uses this value to set the Amplitude Units attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Specifies the input impedance. The driver uses this value to set the Input Impedance attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Specifies the amplitude value of the reference level. The driver uses this value to set the Reference Level attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Specifies the offset value to the reference level. The driver uses this value to set the Reference Level Offset attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Turns auto attenuation on/off. The driver uses this value to set the Attenuation Auto attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

Specifies the attenuation level. If AttenuationAuto is True then this parameter is ignored. The driver uses this value to set the Attenuation attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel.AmplitudeUnits
member.summary: Specifies the amplitude units for input, output and display amplitude.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel.InputImpedance
member.summary: Specifies the value of input impedance expected at the active input port.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel.AttenuationAutoEnabled
member.summary: Turns attenuation aut on/off.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel.Attenuation
member.summary: Specifies the input attenuation (in positive dB).

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel.AttenuationOptimize
member.summary: When on, it executes the adjustment algorithm each time a measurement restarts. (Therefore, in Continuous, it only executes before the first measurement.) The spectrum analyzer measurement, Swept SA, does not support this functionality. Sets the optional attenuation Off, Electrical or a combination of mechanical and electrical.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel.AttenuationStepIncrement
member.summary: Permits the selection of 2 dB or 10 dB step resolution for input attenuation.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel.ElectronicAttenuation
member.summary: Electronic attenuation range: 0-24 db. The electronic attenuator is unavailable above 3.6 GHz. Therefore, if the Elec Atten is enabled, then the Stop Freq of the analyzer is limited to 3.6 GHz, which is to say the start, stop, center frequency and span values are all limited to a maximum of 3.6 GHz + Frequency Offset.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel.ElectronicAttenuationEnabled
member.summary: When the Electrical Attenuator is enabled, the Mechanical Attenuator transitions to a state in which it has no Auto function. Sets the mechanical attenuator to 10 db and the electronic attenuator to a value where the combinded mechanical and electronic attenuation equals the value of the mechanical attenuator (10db) before enabling electronic attenuation within the limits of the electronic attenuator (0-24db).

member.summary: This function copies one trace array to another trace array.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnTracesMath.ConfigureFunctions(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceMathEnum,Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceMathFunctionEnum,Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceMathEnum,Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceMathEnum,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Turns on and configures trace math functions. Trace math functions perform mathematical operations between traces and, in some cases, user-specified offsets. When in a trace math function, the indicated function is performed during the sweep with the math function used in place of a detector. For some of the math modes some of the parameters are not relevant. For those modes, the parameters are ignored.
member.param: Enumerations for math traces.
Enumerations for mathematical function to be performed on trace data.
Enumerations for math traces.
Enumerations for math traces.
Log offset from the First Trace operand and puts the result in the destination trace.
Offsets the difference between the First Trace operand and the Second Trace operand by a reference and puts the result in the destination trace.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStateTrigger.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the provided string to the list of possible LAN events to Input as a response to instrument events.
member.param: List of possible LAN events Name.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStateTrigger.DisableAllTriggerSources
member.summary: Causes all LXI Input LAN Events to go into the disabled state (Enabled = false).

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStateTrigger.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the provided string from the list of LXI Input LAN Events.
member.param: list of possible LAN events Name.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStateTrigger.RemoveAllCustomStateTriggerSources
member.summary: Clears the list of custom LAN events (those introduced using the Add command).

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStateTrigger.Detection
member.summary: - Selecting 'Rise' causes the instrument to trigger on the receipt of a signal low LAN Event followed by a signal high LAN Event. - Selecting 'Fall' causes the instrument to trigger on the receipt of a signal high LAN Event followed by a signal low LAN Event. - Selecting 'High' causes the instrument to trigger on every signal high LAN Event. - Selecting 'Low' causes the instrument to trigger on every signal low LAN Event.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStateTrigger.Enabled
member.summary: When the Enabled parameter is set to ON, receiving the given LAN Event causes the instrument to transition to the state held in the Next State Slot. When the Enabled parameter is OFF, the Input LAN Event is ignored.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStateTrigger.EventId
member.summary: Sets the string that is expected to arrive over the LAN for a given Input LAN Event to occur. The Identifier is variable to allow for easier system debugging.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStateTrigger.Filter
member.summary: Only LXI Input LAN Events coming from hosts matching the filter string are processed. The syntax for specifying a filter is as follows: Filter == ([host[:port]] | [ALL[:port]]) [,Filter] Specifying an empty string means that LXI trigger packets are accepted as an Input from any port on any host on the network via either TCP or UDP. Specifying only the port means that any host communicating over that port can send events. Specifying ALL indicates that UDP multicast packets are accepted if they are directed to the IANA assigned multicast address on the IANA assigned default port, or the designated port if specified. Examples: - '192.168.0.1:23' - 'agilent.com, soco.agilent.com' - 'agilent.com:80, 192.168.0.1'

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStateTrigger.StateLocation
member.summary: This property is used to store the file paths of the state files to be recalled when each Input LAN Event is received. Since each LAN Event has its own Location entry, a given state is capable of branching to at least 8 different states. If custom Input events are added, an even greater branching factor is possible. When setting up state transitions, it is important to set the location of the next state before saving. This way, when the saved state is recalled, the next state locations are also automatically recalled.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus.ConfigureServiceRequest(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSRQReasonEnum)
member.summary: Clears all the enable registers. It then sets the appropriate transition filters and enable registers so when the specified event(s) occur(s) the instrument requests service. All other events are disabled from generating a service request. To detect a service request the client application must poll the status byte using the Status.SerialPoll method or Status.Register property and test the request service bit.
member.param: The defined values are powers of two, 1, 2, 4, etc. The client can OR several reasons together so multiple events can generate a service request.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem.Date
member.summary: Current date formatted as 'YYYY, MM,DD'. YYYY is a four-digit representation of the year including century and millennium information. MM is a two-digit representation of the month where January is 1 and December is 12. DD is the day of the month.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem.SerialNumber
member.summary: Instrument serial number.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem.Time
member.summary: Current time formatted as 'HH,MM,SS.SSSSS'. HH is the hour and its range is 0 to 23 inclusive. MM is the minute and its range is 0 to 59 inclusive. SS is the second in the range 0 to 59.999.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem.TimeoutMilliseconds
member.summary:
The value, in milliseconds, of the default timeout used by I/O operations. This property provides access to the driver's Visa Session Timeout.

Only in rare, unusual circumstances should the client set this property. Driver methods and properties with operations which take a significant time to perform are responsible for adjusting the I/O timeout to an appropriate value. Some methods provide a MaxTimeMilliseconds parameter which gives the client direct control over the timeout value for that method. Sometimes, however, increasing the timeout value can work around an obscure driver defect. Note: If using an Agilent 82357A USB/GPIB interface, the minimum timeout is 2000ms.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem.TraceEnabled
member.summary: If true, outputs a trace log of all driver calls to an xml file in the same directory as the applicatioin executable accessing the driver. Generates default unique file names based on date and time. A new file is generated each time the driver is initialized. You may specify the trace file name using 'TraceName=' the 'DriverSetup=' option string parameter to the Initialize() method. For example: 'DriverSetup= TraceName=TraceOutput'

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem.DirectIO
member.summary: References a pointer to the IFormattedIO488 interface associated with the I/O object used by the driver. The client can use this interface to communicate directly to the instrument using all the capabilities of the I/O interface.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSABurstPowerMarker.CoupleEnabled
member.summary: Turns On or Off the marker coupling feature.When this function is On, moving any marker causes an equal X axis movement of every other marker which is not Off. By 'equal X axis movement' it is meant that the system preserves the difference between each marker's X axis value (in the fundamental x-axis units of the trace that marker is on) and the X axis value of the marker being moved (in the same fundamental x-axis units).

member.summary: Turns On or Off the marker coupling feature.When this function is On, moving any marker causes an equal X axis movement of every other marker which is not Off. By 'equal X axis movement' it is meant that the system preserves the difference between each marker's X axis value (in the fundamental x-axis units of the trace that marker is on) and the X axis value of the marker being moved (in the same fundamental x-axis units).

member.summary: Turns sweep time auto on or off.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAOccupiedBandwidthSweepCoupling.SweepTimeAutoRules
member.summary: Switches the analyzer between normal and accuracy sweep states. Setting Auto Sweep Time to Accy will result in slower sweep times, usually about three times as long, but better amplitude accuracy for CW signals. The instrument amplitude accuracy specifications only apply when Auto Sweep Time is set to Accy. Additional amplitude errors which occur when Auto Sweep Time is set to Norm are usually well under 0.1 dB, though this is not guaranteed. Because of the faster sweep times and still low errors, Norm is the preferred setting of Auto Sweep Time. Auto Sweep Time is set to Norm on a Preset or Auto Couple. This means that in the Preset or Auto Coupled state, instrument amplitude accuracy specifications do not apply.

member.summary: Activates the auto rules for IF Gain. member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASEMaskReferenceChannel
member.summary: IAgXSAnSASEMaskReferenceChannel interface.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASEMaskReferenceChannel.CPSD
member.summary: Sets/Gets the power spectral density in the carrier that is used to compute the relative power spectral density values for the offsets when Meas Type is set to PSD Ref. When the state is set to auto, this will be set to the measured carrier power spectral density.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASEMaskReferenceChannel.TotalPower
member.summary: Sets/Gets the power in the carrier (ref channel) that will be used to compute the relative power values for the offsets. When the TotalPowerAutoEnabled is set to true, this value is set to the measured carrier reference power. When TotalPowerAutoEnabled is set to false, the result takes on the last measured value, or can be manually entered.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASEMaskReferenceChannel.TotalPowerAutoEnabled
member.summary: Turns on/off carrier power auto mode.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASEMaskReferenceChannel.PeakPower
member.summary: Sets the spectrum peak power in the carrier that is used to compute the relative power spectral density values for the offsets when Meas Type is set to Spectrum Peak. When the TotalPowerAutoEnabled is set to true, this value is set to the measured carrier reference power. When TotalPowerAutoEnabled is set to false, the result takes on the last measured value, or can be manually entered.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASEMaskReferenceChannel.DetectorTypeAutoEnabled
member.summary: Sets the detector to the default detection mode for the reference channel. This mode is dependent upon the current reference channel conditions.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASEMaskMarker.CoupleEnabled
member.summary: Turns On or Off the marker coupling feature.When this function is On, moving any marker causes an equal X axis movement of every other marker which is not Off. By 'equal X axis movement' it is meant that the system preserves the difference between each marker's X axis value (in the fundamental x-axis units of the trace that marker is on) and the X axis value of the marker being moved (in the same fundamental x-axis units).

member.summary: Turns On or Off the offsets. Turning the offset has the same effect as setting the frequency of the offset to 0 Hz.
member.param: Turns On or Off the offsets State.

member.summary: Sets the frequency difference from the center of the main channel to the center of the offset.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPOffsetList.ConfigureRelativeLimitPSD(System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Specifies a relative limit value for the level of the power spectral density. This sets the amplitude levels to test against for any custom offsets. The amplitude level is relative to the power spectral density. If multiple offsets are available, the list contains six (6) entries. The offset closest to the carrier channel is the first one in the list.

member.summary: Configures the carriers for this measurement. It allows spaces to be inserted between carriers. Carriers with the power present parameter set to Yes are carriers, and those with the power present parameter set to No are spaces. Each carrier power present is set to Yes or No.

member.summary: Queries the Measurement Noise Bandwidth used to calculate the power in the carriers.

member.summary: Queries the carrier configuration method settings.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList.QueryPowerPresent
member.summary: The query for this parameter returns the current values for all of the carriers. If a carrier is defined as having no power present, the power displayed will be relative to the reference carrier, otherwise the absolute power will be displayed. If user changes the carrier power present to no and that carrier is currently configured as the reference carrier, the next carrier to the left (or the right if there are no carriers to the left) will be assigned as the reference carrier. This also applies to the scenario where there are only two carriers configured as having power present and you configure only one carrier to have no power present.
member.returns: Current values for all of the carriers.

member.summary: Turns On or Off the marker coupling feature.When this function is On, moving any marker causes an equal X axis movement of every other marker which is not Off. By 'equal X axis movement' it is meant that the system preserves the difference between each marker's X axis value (in the fundamental x-axis units of the trace that marker is on) and the X axis value of the marker being moved (in the same fundamental x-axis units).

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionsRangeTable.ConfigureSweepTimeAutoRules(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSweepTimeAutoRulesEnum[]@)
member.summary: Switches the analyzer between normal and accuracy sweep states. Setting Auto Sweep Time to Accy will result in slower sweep times, usually about three times as long, but better amplitude accuracy for CW signals. The instrument amplitude accuracy specifications only apply when Auto Sweep Time is set to Accy. Additional amplitude errors which occur when Auto Sweep Time is set to Norm are usually well under 0.1 dB, though this is not guaranteed. Because of the faster sweep times and still low errors, Norm is the preferred setting of Auto Sweep Time. Auto Sweep Time is set to Norm on a Preset or Auto Couple. This means that in the Preset or Auto Coupled state, instrument amplitude accuracy specifications do not apply.
member.param: Auto Sweep Time Rule.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionsRangeTable.QuerySweepTimeAutoRules
member.summary: Switches the analyzer between normal and accuracy sweep states. Setting Auto Sweep Time to Accy will result in slower sweep times, usually about three times as long, but better amplitude accuracy for CW signals. The instrument amplitude accuracy specifications only apply when Auto Sweep Time is set to Accy. Additional amplitude errors which occur when Auto Sweep Time is set to Norm are usually well under 0.1 dB, though this is not guaranteed. Because of the faster sweep times and still low errors, Norm is the preferred setting of Auto Sweep Time. Auto Sweep Time is set to Norm on a Preset or Auto Couple. This means that in the Preset or Auto Coupled state, instrument amplitude accuracy specifications do not apply.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAHarmonicDistortionSweepCoupling.SweepTimeEnabled
member.summary: Selects the length of time in which the spectrum analyzer sweeps when measuring the fundamental. Additional overhead time is required by the analyzer that impacts the sweep rate, but is not calculated as part of the dwell time. Reducing the sweep time increases the rate of sweeps. The dwell time normally changes with the resolution bandwidth, so by default the dwell time varies with each harmonic. If Dwell Time Auto is off, the harmonics will have the same dwell time unless the Range Table is used

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAThirdOrderInterceptZeroSpanSweepCoupling.ResolutionBandwidth
member.summary: Sets/Gets the Zero-Span RBW. This resolution bandwidth is used when making the zero-span intermod measurements when Zero-Span measurement is active. The Zero-Span RBW is typically smaller than the main resolution bandwidth, although it must still be large enough to accommodate three times the width of the intermodulation products.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAThirdOrderInterceptZeroSpanSweepCoupling.ResolutionBandwidthAutoEnabled
member.summary: Turns resolution bandwidth auto on and off.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAThirdOrderInterceptZeroSpanSweepCoupling.SweepTime
member.summary: Sets/Gets the sweep time used when making the zero-span intermod measurements when Zero-Span measurement is turned on. Additional sweep time gives better noise performance.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAThirdOrderInterceptZeroSpanSweepCoupling.SweepTimeAutoEnabled
member.summary: Turns sweep time auto on or off.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating
member.summary: IAgXSAnSAGating interface.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.Delay
member.summary: Controls the length of time from the time the gate condition goes True until the gate is turned on.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.Enabled
member.summary: Turns the gate function on and off. When the Gate Function is on, the selected Gate Method is used along with the gate settings and the signal at the gate source to control the sweep and video system with the gate signal. Not all measurements allow every type of Gate Methods. When Gate is on, the annunciation in the Meas Bar reflects that it is on and what method is used, as seen in the 'Gate: LO' annunciator below.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.Length
member.summary: Controls the length of time that the gate is on after it opens.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.Method
member.summary: This lets the user to choose one of the three different types of gating. Not all types of gating are available for all measurements.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.MinFast
member.summary: This command queries the position of the MIN FAST line, relative to the delay reference (REF) line.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.Source
member.summary: Any trigger settings changes made under Gate Source also affect settings under Trigger, and vice versa. However the selected Trigger Source does not have to match the Gate Source.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.Type
member.summary: Sets the method of controlling the gating function from the gating signal.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.View
member.summary: Turning on Gate View in the Swept SA measurement provides a single-window gate view display. Turning on Gate View in other measurements shows the split-screen Gate View.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.ViewSweepTime
member.summary: Controls the sweep time in the Gate View window. Since this variable is used to calculate Gate Length and Gate Delay increments, it must be maintained even when not in Gate View. It is initialized when Gate View turns on and every time the Gate Method is set while Gate View is on. Not all Gate methods are available for all modes.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.HoldOffTime
member.summary: Sets/Gets the wait time after a gate event ends before the analyzer will respond to the next gate signal.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.HoldOffTimeAutoEnabled
member.summary: Turns gate hold off time auto coupling on/off.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating.DelayCompensation
member.summary: Allows user to select/Query an RBW-dependent value by which to adjust the gate delay, to compensate for changes in the delay caused by RBW effects.

member.summary: Accesses limit line data.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.UpdateOffsets
member.summary: Adds the X and Y offsets to each point in the limit table, then resets the X and Y offset values to zero. This has no effect on the position of the limit trace.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.AmplitudeInterpolator
member.summary: Allows user to determine how limit trace values are computed between points in a limit table.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.Comment
member.summary: Sets an ASCII comment field which will be stored in an exported file.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.DisplayEnabled
member.summary: Turns limit-line display On or Off. Either Limit or Margin, as well as Test, must be turned on to turn on a limit test.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.Domain
member.summary: Selects how the limit-line segments are defined. Pressing X Axis Units selects whether the limit lines will be entered using frequency (Freq) or sweep time (Time) to define the segments.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.Enabled
member.summary: Selects whether displayed traces are tested against displayed limits

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.Fail
member.summary: Queries whether a trace passed all limits.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.FrequencyInterpolator
member.summary: Sets the interpolation to linear or logarithmic for the specified limiting points set, allowing user to determine how limit trace values are computed between points in a limit table.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.Margin
member.summary: Selects a margin for the selected limit, which will cause a trace to Fail Margin when the trace is between the limit line and the margin line.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.MarginEnabled
member.summary: Turns margin On or Off. Selecting On allows user to set a limit-line offset for the selected limit line. Only positive margins are allowed for lower limits and only negative margins are allowed for upper limits.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.Mode
member.summary: Specifies whether the current limit lines are fixed or relative.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.RealtiveToCenterFrequencyEnabled
member.summary: Chooses whether the limit line frequency points are coupled to the instrument enter frequency, and whether the frequency points are expressed as an offset from the instrument center frequency. If the limit lines are specified with time, this has no effect. The limit table must in this case support negative frequencies.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.RelativeToAmplitudeEnabled
member.summary: Chooses whether the limit line amplitude points are coupled to the instrument reference level, and whether the amplitude points are expressed as an offset from the instrument reference level.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.TestTrace
member.summary: Selects the trace you want the limit to test. A limit is applied to one and only one trace; each trace can have both an upper and a lower limit. When executing Limit Test, the limit is applied only to the specified trace.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.Type
member.summary: Allows user to define the limit you are editing as either an upper or lower limit. An Upper limit fails if the trace exceeds the limit. A Lower limit fails if the trace falls below the limit.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.XOffset
member.summary: Offsets the limit trace by some specified frequency (for Frequency-based limit lines) or a time (for time-based limit lines).

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.YOffset
member.summary: Offsets all segments in the limit line by some specified amplitude.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSALimit.LineEnabled
member.summary: Sets or queries whether the limit line is tested.

member.summary: If a sweep is in process when this function executes it aborts, and restarts after the function is complete.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAListSweep.Configure
member.summary: The List Sweep measurement is designed for fast measurement throughput. It lets you remotely extract amplitude values for multiple detectors at known frequencies. You can configure the analyzer to make a list of single-point measurements. This list can then be run multiple times saving analyzer setup time and reducing I/O overhead and traffic. The measurements are all performed in zero-span for the first release.

member.summary: Selects list sweep measurement as current measurement but does not restore its parameters to their default values.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAListSweepTime.Points
member.summary: This command defines a list of analyzer sweep times at which the measurements are made. In zero span measurements, this is the time required to measure a single point given the current setting for the number of points in the sweep.The time duration of the measurement specified by this command is not the time required to iterate from one point to another; rather, it is the equivalent of the ?bucket width? for a normal swept measurement. In the Average detector, it is the integration time; in the peak detector, it is the time during which the highest peak is captured. The time required to complete a point will be the sum of the SWEep time and the settling time.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerFrequencyCounter
member.summary: IVI SpecAn class-compliant marker frequency counter interface

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerFrequencyCounter.Configure(System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: This function sets the marker frequency counter resolution and turns the marker frequency counter on/off.
member.param: Turns marker frequency counter on/off. The driver uses this value to set the Marker Frequency Counter Enabled attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

Specifies the frequency counter resolution in hertz. This value is ignored when markerFrequencyCounter is False.This value is restricted to a power of ten. An attempt to set this to other than a power of ten results in an error without the value being changed.The driver uses this value to set the Marker Frequency Counter Resolution attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerFrequencyCounter.QueryCount
member.summary: Queries the frequency count. The query returns the absolute count unless the specified marker is in Delta mode, then it returns the relative count. If the marker is off, or the marker is on but the counter is off, the analyzer will return not a number.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerFrequencyCounter.Enabled
member.summary: This function activates/deactivates the marker counter.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerFrequencyCounter.Resolution
member.summary: Specifies the resolution of the frequency counter in Hertz.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerFrequencyCounter.GateTime
member.summary: Sets the length of time during which the frequency counter measures the signal frequency.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerFrequencyCounter.GateTimeAutoEnabled
member.summary: Turns gate time auto on and off.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerFrequencyCounter.ResolutionAutoEnabled
member.summary: Get/Set the auto resolution of the frequency counter in Hertz.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerNDBPoints
member.summary: IAgXSAnMarkerNDBPoints interface.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerNDBPoints.Enabled
member.summary: Turns N dB points on and off. N dB uses the selected marker. If the selected marker is not on when N dB is turned on, the selected marker turns on, as a Normal marker, at center screen, and is used by N dB. A marker should be placed on the peak of interest before turning on N dB points. The N dB points function looks for the two points on the marker's trace closest to the marker's X Axis value that are N dB below the marker's amplitude, one above and the other below the marker's X Axis value.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerNDBPoints.Value
member.summary: The amplitude points to measure the bandwidth relative to the active marker.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarkerNDBPoints.Results
member.summary: The frequency difference between the N db bandwidth points.

member.summary: Enables/disables signal tracking.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.Threshold
member.summary: Specifies the lower limit for the marker search functions.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.Trace
member.summary: Specifies the trace for the active marker.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.CoupleEnabled
member.summary: Turns On or Off the marker coupling feature.When this function is On, moving any marker causes an equal X axis movement of every other marker which is not Off. By equal X axis movement it is meant that the system preserves the difference between each marker's X axis value (in the fundamental x-axis units of the trace that marker is on) and the X axis value of the marker being moved (in the same fundamental x-axis units).

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.DeltaReference
member.summary: Selects the marker that the active marker will be relative to (its reference marker). The marker must be a Delta marker to make this property relevant.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.Enabled
member.summary: Turns the marker on or off.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.Function
member.summary: Sets the marker function.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.FunctionBandLeft
member.summary: Sets the left edge frequency or time value for the band of the selected marker.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.FunctionBandRight
member.summary: Sets the right edge frequency or time value for the band of the selected marker.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.FunctionBandSpan
member.summary: Sets the width of the frequency span for the selected marker.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.LinesEnabled
member.summary: When on, displays a vertical line of graticule height and a horizontal line of graticule width, intersecting at the indicator point of the marker (that is, the center of the X or the bottom tip of the diamond. The lines are blue (0,0,255) in color. If the marker is offscreen the lines should be extended from the marker so that they go thru the screen area if possible. This is really useful for offscreen Fixed markers as it lets you see their amplitude even though they are off the X Axis.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.PeakTableEnabled
member.summary: Turns Peak Table on/off. When turned on, the display is split into a measurement window and a peak table display window. Turning the Peak Table on turns the Marker Table off and vice versa.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.XAxisScale
member.summary: Controls how the x-axis information for the selected marker is displayed in the marker area (top-right of display) and the active function area of the display.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.XAxisScaleAutoEnabled
member.summary: When in Auto, the X Axis Scale is Frequency if the Marker Trace is a frequency domain trace, Tim e if the Marker Trace is a time domain trace. When in Auto, if the marker changes traces, or the domain of the trace the marker is on changes, the Auto result is re-evaluated. If the X Axis Scale is chosen manually, that Scale is used regardless of the domain of the trace.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.TableEnabled
member.summary: Splits display into a measurement window and a marker data display window.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.TraceAutoEnabled
member.summary: Turns trace auto mode on and off. In Auto mode, the analyzer places the marker on the lowest-numbered trace which is in ClearWrite mode.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.Y
member.summary: The command selects the marker and sets the marker Y Axis value; the default unit is the current Y Axis unit. It has no effect (other than selecting the marker) unless the marker control mode is Fixed.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.NDBPoints
member.summary: Pointer to IAgXSAnMarkerNDBPoints interface.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.ContinuousPeakSearchEnabled
member.summary: Turns Continuous Peak Search on or off. When Continuous Peak Search is on, a peak search is automatically performed for the selected marker after each sweep. The rules for finding the peak are exactly the same as for Peak Search, including the use of the peak criteria rules. If no valid peak is found, a warning is generated after each sweep.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.FunctionBandSpanAutoEnabled
member.summary: Sets/Get the width of the frequency auto span for the selected marker.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.ThresholdEnabled
member.summary: Turns the peak threshold requirement on/off

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.PeakExcursionEnabled
member.summary: Turns the peak excursion requirement on/off.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.PeakTableReadoutMode
member.summary: Reads up to twenty signal peaks as defined by the setting:

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.PeakSortMode
member.summary: Sets the peak table sorting routine to list the peaks in order of descending amplitude or ascending frequency.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAMarker.PeakSearchMode
member.summary: Enables user to decide the mode of peak search to be performed.

member.summary: Sets the marker X position in trace points

member.summary: This function configures the coupling and sweeping attributes of the IviSpecAn.
member.param: Turns resolution bandwidth auto coupling on/off. The driver uses this value to set the Resolution Bandwidth Auto attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

Specifies the measurement resolution bandwidth in Hertz. This value is ignored when ResolutionBandwidthAuto is True. The driver uses this value to set the Resolution Bandwidth attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Turns video bandwidth auto coupling on/off. The driver uses this value to set the Video Bandwidth Auto attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

Specifies the video bandwidth of the post-detection filter in Hertz. This value is ignored when VideoBandwidthAuto is True. The driver uses this value to set the Video Bandwidth attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Turns sweep time coupling on/off. The driver uses this value to set the Sweep Time Auto attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Specifies the length of time (in seconds) to sweep from the beginning to the end of the current domain.

member.summary: Specifies the video bandwidth of the post-detection filter in Hertz.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem2.DisableLocalControls
member.summary: Puts the instrument into a state where all local controls, including return to local, are disabled from changing the state of the instrument. The power switch is excluded. The client program can ensure that an operator cannot change the state of an instrument through its front panel.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem2.EnableLocalControls
member.summary: Allows an operator to examine and change the instrument's state through its local controls. The client can allow an operator to interact directly with the instrument through its front panel for a period of time.

member.summary: Writes binary instrument state as saved by GetState method.
member.param: Binary data representation of the instrument state as read from the instrument using the GetState method.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem2.Date
member.summary: Current date formatted as 'YYYY, MM,DD'. YYYY is a four-digit representation of the year including century and millennium information. MM is a two-digit representation of the month where January is 1 and December is 12. DD is the day of the month.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem2.SerialNumber
member.summary: Instrument serial number.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem2.Time
member.summary: Current time formatted as 'HH,MM,SS.SSSSS'. HH is the hour and its range is 0 to 23 inclusive. MM is the minute and its range is 0 to 59 inclusive. SS is the second in the range 0 to 59.999.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem2.TimeoutMilliseconds
member.summary:
The value, in milliseconds, of the default timeout used by I/O operations. This property provides access to the driver's Visa Session Timeout.

Only in rare, unusual circumstances should the client set this property. Driver methods and properties with operations which take a significant time to perform are responsible for adjusting the I/O timeout to an appropriate value. Some methods provide a MaxTimeMilliseconds parameter which gives the client direct control over the timeout value for that method. Sometimes, however, increasing the timeout value can work around an obscure driver defect. Note: If using an Agilent 82357A USB/GPIB interface, the minimum timeout is 2000ms.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem2.TraceEnabled
member.summary: If true, outputs a trace log of all driver calls to an xml file in the same directory as the applicatioin executable accessing the driver. Generates default unique file names based on date and time. A new file is generated each time the driver is initialized. You may specify the trace file name using 'TraceName=' the 'DriverSetup=' option string parameter to the Initialize() method. For example: 'DriverSetup= TraceName=TraceOutput'

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem2.DirectIO
member.summary: References a pointer to the IFormattedIO488 interface associated with the I/O object used by the driver. The client can use this interface to communicate directly to the instrument using all the capabilities of the I/O interface.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn2
member.summary: IAgXSAn2 interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn2.Initialize(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are only accessible after Initialize is called. Initialize optionally performs a Reset and queries the instrument to validate the instrument model.
member.param: An IVI logical name or an instrument specific string that identifies the address of the instrument, such as a VISA resource descriptor string.
Specifies whether to verify the ID of the instrument.
Specifies whether to reset the instrument.

The user can use the OptionsString parameter to specify the initial values of certain IVI inherent attributes for the session. The format of an assignment in the OptionsString parameteris "Name=Value", where Name is one of: RangeCheck, QuerytInstrStatus, Cache, Simulate, RecordCoercions, InterchangeCheck,or DriverSetup. Value is either true or false except for DriverSetup. If the Options String parameter contains an assignment for the Driver Setup attribute, the Initialize function assumes that everything following "DriverSetup=" is part of the assignment.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn2.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are not accessible after Close is called.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem4.DisableLocalControls
member.summary: Puts the instrument into a state where all local controls, including return to local, are disabled from changing the state of the instrument. The power switch is excluded. The client program can ensure that an operator cannot change the state of an instrument through its front panel.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem4.EnableLocalControls
member.summary: Allows an operator to examine and change the instrument's state through its local controls. The client can allow an operator to interact directly with the instrument through its front panel for a period of time.

member.summary: Does not return until previously started operations complete or more MaxTimeMilliseconds milliseconds of time have expired.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem4.Date
member.summary: Current date formatted as 'YYYY, MM,DD'. YYYY is a four-digit representation of the year including century and millennium information. MM is a two-digit representation of the month where January is 1 and December is 12. DD is the day of the month.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem4.SerialNumber
member.summary: Instrument serial number.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem4.Time
member.summary: Current time formatted as 'HH,MM,SS.SSSSS'. HH is the hour and its range is 0 to 23 inclusive. MM is the minute and its range is 0 to 59 inclusive. SS is the second in the range 0 to 59.999.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem4.TimeoutMilliseconds
member.summary:
The value, in milliseconds, of the default timeout used by I/O operations. This property provides access to the driver's Visa Session Timeout.

Only in rare, unusual circumstances should the client set this property. Driver methods and properties with operations which take a significant time to perform are responsible for adjusting the I/O timeout to an appropriate value. Some methods provide a MaxTimeMilliseconds parameter which gives the client direct control over the timeout value for that method. Sometimes, however, increasing the timeout value can work around an obscure driver defect. Note: If using an Agilent 82357A USB/GPIB interface, the minimum timeout is 2000ms.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem4.TraceEnabled
member.summary: If true, outputs a trace log of all driver calls to an xml file in the same directory as the applicatioin executable accessing the driver. Generates default unique file names based on date and time. A new file is generated each time the driver is initialized. You may specify the trace file name using 'TraceName=' the 'DriverSetup=' option string parameter to the Initialize() method. For example: 'DriverSetup= TraceName=TraceOutput'

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem4.DirectIO
member.summary: References a pointer to the IFormattedIO488 interface associated with the I/O object used by the driver. The client can use this interface to communicate directly to the instrument using all the capabilities of the I/O interface.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn4
member.summary: IAgXSAn4 interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn4.Initialize(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are only accessible after Initialize is called. Initialize optionally performs a Reset and queries the instrument to validate the instrument model.
member.param: An IVI logical name or an instrument specific string that identifies the address of the instrument, such as a VISA resource descriptor string.
Specifies whether to verify the ID of the instrument.
Specifies whether to reset the instrument.

The user can use the OptionsString parameter to specify the initial values of certain IVI inherent attributes for the session. The format of an assignment in the OptionsString parameteris "Name=Value", where Name is one of: RangeCheck, QuerytInstrStatus, Cache, Simulate, RecordCoercions, InterchangeCheck,or DriverSetup. Value is either true or false except for DriverSetup. If the Options String parameter contains an assignment for the Driver Setup attribute, the Initialize function assumes that everything following "DriverSetup=" is part of the assignment.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn4.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are not accessible after Close is called.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency2
member.summary: IAgXSAnFrequency2 interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency2.ConfigureStartStop(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This function configures the frequency range of the IviSpecAn using start frequency and stop frequency. If start frequency is equal to the stop frequency, then the spectrum analyzer is in time-domain mode. In auto-coupled mode, resolution bandwidth (RBW), video bandwidth (VBW), and sweep time may be affected by this function.
member.param: Specifies the left edge of frequency domain in Hertz.
Specifies the right edge of frequency domain in Hertz.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency2.ConfigureCenterSpan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This function configures the frequency range of the IviSpecAn using the center frequency and frequency span. If span corresponds to zero hertz, then the spectrum analyzer is in time-domain. This function modifies the Frequency Start and Frequency Stop attributes as follows:Frequency Start = center frequency - span/2 and Frequency Stop = center frequency + span/2.In auto-coupled mode, RBW, VBW and sweep time may be affected by this function.
member.param: The center frequency of the frequency sweep (in Hertz).
The frequency span of the frequency sweep (in Hertz).

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency2.FullSpan
member.summary: Sets the analyzer span to full span showing the full frequency range of the analyzer.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency2.PreviousSpan
member.summary: Sets the analyzer frequency span to the previous span setting.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency2.Tune
member.summary: Tune causes the analyzer to change Center Frequency to the strongest signal in the tunable span of the analyzer, excluding the LO.

member.summary: The displayed frequency range about the center frequency.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn5
member.summary: IAgXSAn5 interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn5.Initialize(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are only accessible after Initialize is called. Initialize optionally performs a Reset and queries the instrument to validate the instrument model.
member.param: An IVI logical name or an instrument specific string that identifies the address of the instrument, such as a VISA resource descriptor string.
Specifies whether to verify the ID of the instrument.
Specifies whether to reset the instrument.

The user can use the OptionsString parameter to specify the initial values of certain IVI inherent attributes for the session. The format of an assignment in the OptionsString parameteris "Name=Value", where Name is one of: RangeCheck, QuerytInstrStatus, Cache, Simulate, RecordCoercions, InterchangeCheck,or DriverSetup. Value is either true or false except for DriverSetup. If the Options String parameter contains an assignment for the Driver Setup attribute, the Initialize function assumes that everything following "DriverSetup=" is part of the assignment.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn5.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are not accessible after Close is called.

member.summary: Activates the auto rules for IF Gain. member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionsRangeTable2.ConfigureSweepTimeAutoRules(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSweepTimeAutoRulesEnum[]@)
member.summary: Switches the analyzer between normal and accuracy sweep states. Setting Auto Sweep Time to Accy will result in slower sweep times, usually about three times as long, but better amplitude accuracy for CW signals. The instrument amplitude accuracy specifications only apply when Auto Sweep Time is set to Accy. Additional amplitude errors which occur when Auto Sweep Time is set to Norm are usually well under 0.1 dB, though this is not guaranteed. Because of the faster sweep times and still low errors, Norm is the preferred setting of Auto Sweep Time. Auto Sweep Time is set to Norm on a Preset or Auto Couple. This means that in the Preset or Auto Coupled state, instrument amplitude accuracy specifications do not apply.
member.param: Auto Sweep Time Rule.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionsRangeTable2.QuerySweepTimeAutoRules
member.summary: Switches the analyzer between normal and accuracy sweep states. Setting Auto Sweep Time to Accy will result in slower sweep times, usually about three times as long, but better amplitude accuracy for CW signals. The instrument amplitude accuracy specifications only apply when Auto Sweep Time is set to Accy. Additional amplitude errors which occur when Auto Sweep Time is set to Norm are usually well under 0.1 dB, though this is not guaranteed. Because of the faster sweep times and still low errors, Norm is the preferred setting of Auto Sweep Time. Auto Sweep Time is set to Norm on a Preset or Auto Couple. This means that in the Preset or Auto Coupled state, instrument amplitude accuracy specifications do not apply.

member.summary: This function configures the coupling and sweeping attributes of the IviSpecAn.
member.param: Turns resolution bandwidth auto coupling on/off. The driver uses this value to set the Resolution Bandwidth Auto attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

Specifies the measurement resolution bandwidth in Hertz. This value is ignored when ResolutionBandwidthAuto is True. The driver uses this value to set the Resolution Bandwidth attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Turns video bandwidth auto coupling on/off. The driver uses this value to set the Video Bandwidth Auto attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

Specifies the video bandwidth of the post-detection filter in Hertz. This value is ignored when VideoBandwidthAuto is True. The driver uses this value to set the Video Bandwidth attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Turns sweep time coupling on/off. The driver uses this value to set the Sweep Time Auto attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Specifies the length of time (in seconds) to sweep from the beginning to the end of the current domain.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency3
member.summary: IAgXSAnFrequency3 interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency3.ConfigureStartStop(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This function configures the frequency range of the IviSpecAn using start frequency and stop frequency. If start frequency is equal to the stop frequency, then the spectrum analyzer is in time-domain mode. In auto-coupled mode, resolution bandwidth (RBW), video bandwidth (VBW), and sweep time may be affected by this function.
member.param: Specifies the left edge of frequency domain in Hertz.
Specifies the right edge of frequency domain in Hertz.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency3.ConfigureCenterSpan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This function configures the frequency range of the IviSpecAn using the center frequency and frequency span. If span corresponds to zero hertz, then the spectrum analyzer is in time-domain. This function modifies the Frequency Start and Frequency Stop attributes as follows:Frequency Start = center frequency - span/2 and Frequency Stop = center frequency + span/2.In auto-coupled mode, RBW, VBW and sweep time may be affected by this function.
member.param: The center frequency of the frequency sweep (in Hertz).
The frequency span of the frequency sweep (in Hertz).

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency3.FullSpan
member.summary: Sets the analyzer span to full span showing the full frequency range of the analyzer.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency3.PreviousSpan
member.summary: Sets the analyzer frequency span to the previous span setting.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency3.Tune
member.summary: Tune causes the analyzer to change Center Frequency to the strongest signal in the tunable span of the analyzer, excluding the LO.

member.summary: The left edge of frequency domain in Hertz.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency3.Stop
member.summary: Specifies the right edge of frequency domain in Hertz.

member.summary: The center frequency.

member.summary: The step size for the center frequency and start and stop frequency functions.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency3.Span
member.summary: The displayed frequency range about the center frequency.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnFrequency3.Synthesis
member.summary: The LO (local oscillator) phase noise behavior that is optimum for measurement accuracy.

member.summary: Enables or disable the center frequency step size automatic mode.

member.summary: Allows the analyzer to automatically select an LO phase noise behavior that is optimum for the selected span and RBW.

member.summary: Enables/Disables the automatic setting up of the ratio between the span and the resolution bandwidth.

Carrier spacing values.

member.summary: Configures the carriers for this measurement. It allows spaces to be inserted between carriers. Carriers with the power present parameter set to Yes are carriers, and those with the power present parameter set to No are spaces. Each carrier power present is set to Yes or No.
member.param: ACP Carrier List Power Channel.

member.summary: Queries the carrier configuration method settings.
member.returns: ON or OFF State of the carrier configuration method.

member.summary: Queries the state of carrier settings couplings to carrier #1. The coupled parameters are Carrier Power Preset, Carrier Spacing, Measurement Noise Bandwidth, Method and Filter Alpha.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList2.QueryIntegrationBandwidth
member.summary: Queries the Measurement Noise Bandwidth used to calculate the power in the carriers.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList2.QueryMethod
member.summary: Queries the carrier configuration method settings.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList2.QueryPowerPresent
member.summary: The query for this parameter returns the current values for all of the carriers. If a carrier is defined as having no power present, the power displayed will be relative to the reference carrier, otherwise the absolute power will be displayed. If user changes the carrier power present to no and that carrier is currently configured as the reference carrier, the next carrier to the left (or the right if there are no carriers to the left) will be assigned as the reference carrier. This also applies to the scenario where there are only two carriers configured as having power present and you configure only one carrier to have no power present.
member.returns: Current values for all of the carriers.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList2.ConfigureAlphaValue(System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Sets the Alpha values for the filter used in the current carrier configuration.
member.param: Input range is from 0.01 to 1.0.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2
member.summary: IAgXSAnLevel2 interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2.Configure(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnAmplitudeUnitsEnum,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: This function configures the vertical attributes of the IviSpecAn.
member.param: Specifies the amplitude units for input, output and display. The driver uses this value to set the Amplitude Units attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Specifies the input impedance. The driver uses this value to set the Input Impedance attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Specifies the amplitude value of the reference level. The driver uses this value to set the Reference Level attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Specifies the offset value to the reference level. The driver uses this value to set the Reference Level Offset attribute. See the attribute description for more details.
Turns auto attenuation on/off. The driver uses this value to set the Attenuation Auto attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

Specifies the attenuation level. If AttenuationAuto is True then this parameter is ignored. The driver uses this value to set the Attenuation attribute. See the attribute description for more details.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2.AmplitudeUnits
member.summary: Specifies the amplitude units for input, output and display amplitude.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2.InputImpedance
member.summary: Specifies the value of input impedance expected at the active input port.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2.AttenuationAutoEnabled
member.summary: Turns attenuation aut on/off.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2.Attenuation
member.summary: Specifies the input attenuation (in positive dB).

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2.AttenuationOptimize
member.summary: When on, it executes the adjustment algorithm each time a measurement restarts. (Therefore, in Continuous, it only executes before the first measurement.) The spectrum analyzer measurement, Swept SA, does not support this functionality. Sets the optional attenuation Off, Electrical or a combination of mechanical and electrical.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2.AttenuationStepIncrement
member.summary: Permits the selection of 2 dB or 10 dB step resolution for input attenuation.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2.ElectronicAttenuation
member.summary: Electronic attenuation range: 0-24 db. The electronic attenuator is unavailable above 3.6 GHz. Therefore, if the Elec Atten is enabled, then the Stop Freq of the analyzer is limited to 3.6 GHz, which is to say the start, stop, center frequency and span values are all limited to a maximum of 3.6 GHz + Frequency Offset.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2.ElectronicAttenuationEnabled
member.summary: When the Electrical Attenuator is enabled, the Mechanical Attenuator transitions to a state in which it has no Auto function. Sets the mechanical attenuator to 10 db and the electronic attenuator to a value where the combinded mechanical and electronic attenuation equals the value of the mechanical attenuator (10db) before enabling electronic attenuation within the limits of the electronic attenuator (0-24db).

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnLevel2.MixerOffset
member.summary: Advanced setting to adjust target Range at the input mixer which in turn affects the signal level in the instruments IF.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2
member.summary: IAgXSAnSAGating2 interface.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.Delay
member.summary: Controls the length of time from the time the gate condition goes True until the gate is turned on.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.Enabled
member.summary: Turns the gate function on and off. When the Gate Function is on, the selected Gate Method is used along with the gate settings and the signal at the gate source to control the sweep and video system with the gate signal. Not all measurements allow every type of Gate Methods. When Gate is on, the annunciation in the Meas Bar reflects that it is on and what method is used, as seen in the 'Gate: LO' annunciator below.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.Length
member.summary: Controls the length of time that the gate is on after it opens.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.Method
member.summary: This lets the user to choose one of the three different types of gating. Not all types of gating are available for all measurements.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.MinFast
member.summary: This command queries the position of the MIN FAST line, relative to the delay reference (REF) line.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.Source
member.summary: Any trigger settings changes made under Gate Source also affect settings under Trigger, and vice versa. However the selected Trigger Source does not have to match the Gate Source.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.Type
member.summary: Sets the method of controlling the gating function from the gating signal.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.View
member.summary: Turning on Gate View in the Swept SA measurement provides a single-window gate view display. Turning on Gate View in other measurements shows the split-screen Gate View.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.ViewSweepTime
member.summary: Controls the sweep time in the Gate View window. Since this variable is used to calculate Gate Length and Gate Delay increments, it must be maintained even when not in Gate View. It is initialized when Gate View turns on and every time the Gate Method is set while Gate View is on. Not all Gate methods are available for all modes.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.HoldOffTime
member.summary: Sets/Gets the wait time after a gate event ends before the analyzer will respond to the next gate signal.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.HoldOffTimeAutoEnabled
member.summary: Turns gate hold off time auto coupling on/off.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.DelayCompensation
member.summary: Allows user to select/Query an RBW-dependent value by which to adjust the gate delay, to compensate for changes in the delay caused by RBW effects.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAGating2.ViewStartTime
member.summary: Controls the time at the left edge of the Gate View.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5
member.summary: IAgXSAnSystem5 interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.DisableLocalControls
member.summary: Puts the instrument into a state where all local controls, including return to local, are disabled from changing the state of the instrument. The power switch is excluded. The client program can ensure that an operator cannot change the state of an instrument through its front panel.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.EnableLocalControls
member.summary: Allows an operator to examine and change the instrument's state through its local controls. The client can allow an operator to interact directly with the instrument through its front panel for a period of time.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.GetScreenImage(System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Retuns an array whose contents may be saved as a image file of the current display.
member.param: Binary GIF file data of the current instrument display.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.GetState(System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Binary current instrument state. May be restored using PutState method. Data is in internal instrument format, do not alter.
member.param: Binary data representation of the current instrument state.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.PutState(System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Writes binary instrument state as saved by GetState method.
member.param: Binary data representation of the instrument state as read from the instrument using the GetState method.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.RecallState(System.String)
member.summary: Restore the instrument to a state previously stored in the instrument's internal memory.
member.param: A string which identifies which one of many internal memory locations was used to store the instrument's state.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.SaveState(System.String)
member.summary: Save the instrument's state the instrument's internal memory.
member.param: A string which identifies which one of many internal memory locations is to be used to store the instrument's state.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.WaitForOperationComplete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Does not return until previously started operations complete or more MaxTimeMilliseconds milliseconds of time have expired.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.Date
member.summary: Current date formatted as 'YYYY, MM,DD'. YYYY is a four-digit representation of the year including century and millennium information. MM is a two-digit representation of the month where January is 1 and December is 12. DD is the day of the month.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.SerialNumber
member.summary: Instrument serial number.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.Time
member.summary: Current time formatted as 'HH,MM,SS.SSSSS'. HH is the hour and its range is 0 to 23 inclusive. MM is the minute and its range is 0 to 59 inclusive. SS is the second in the range 0 to 59.999.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.TimeoutMilliseconds
member.summary:
The value, in milliseconds, of the default timeout used by I/O operations. This property provides access to the driver's Visa Session Timeout.

Only in rare, unusual circumstances should the client set this property. Driver methods and properties with operations which take a significant time to perform are responsible for adjusting the I/O timeout to an appropriate value. Some methods provide a MaxTimeMilliseconds parameter which gives the client direct control over the timeout value for that method. Sometimes, however, increasing the timeout value can work around an obscure driver defect. Note: If using an Agilent 82357A USB/GPIB interface, the minimum timeout is 2000ms.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.TraceEnabled
member.summary: If true, outputs a trace log of all driver calls to an xml file in the same directory as the applicatioin executable accessing the driver. Generates default unique file names based on date and time. A new file is generated each time the driver is initialized. You may specify the trace file name using 'TraceName=' the 'DriverSetup=' option string parameter to the Initialize() method. For example: 'DriverSetup= TraceName=TraceOutput'

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSystem5.DirectIO
member.summary: References a pointer to the IFormattedIO488 interface associated with the I/O object used by the driver. The client can use this interface to communicate directly to the instrument using all the capabilities of the I/O interface.

member.summary: Enables or disables the I/Q adjustments.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn5SSDigitalModulationArbIQAdjustment.Gain
member.summary: Adjust the ratio of I to Q while preserving the composite, vector magnitude. Adding Gain (+x dB) to the signal increases the I component and decreases the Q component proportionally. Reducing Gain (-x dB) decreases the I component and increases the Q component proportionally.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn5SSDigitalModulationArbIQAdjustment.Delay
member.summary: The absolute phase of both I and Q with respect to triggers and markers. A positive value delays I and Q. This value affects both the external I/Q out signals and the baseband signal modulated on the RF output. This adjustment does not affect external I/Q inputs.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn6
member.summary: IAgXSAn6 interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn6.Initialize(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Opens the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are only accessible after Initialize is called. Initialize optionally performs a Reset and queries the instrument to validate the instrument model.
member.param: An IVI logical name or an instrument specific string that identifies the address of the instrument, such as a VISA resource descriptor string.
Specifies whether to verify the ID of the instrument.
Specifies whether to reset the instrument.

The user can use the OptionsString parameter to specify the initial values of certain IVI inherent attributes for the session. The format of an assignment in the OptionsString parameteris "Name=Value", where Name is one of: RangeCheck, QuerytInstrStatus, Cache, Simulate, RecordCoercions, InterchangeCheck,or DriverSetup. Value is either true or false except for DriverSetup. If the Options String parameter contains an assignment for the Driver Setup attribute, the Initialize function assumes that everything following "DriverSetup=" is part of the assignment.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAn6.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument. Driver methods and properties that access the instrument are not accessible after Close is called.
