member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.ConfigureCarrierMethod(System.Boolean[]@)
member.summary: Configure the carrier configuration method settings.
member.param:
State values translate as follows: 1|ON = RRC Weighted 0|OFF = Integ BW
Maximum of Array length depends on the number of carriers.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.ConfigureChannelSpacing(System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Sets the width of the carrier spacing. This will be the value applied to all the current slots, whether they are carriers or spaces.
member.param:
Carrier spacing values.
Maximum of Array length depends on the number of carriers. Changing Carrier Spacing might affect the Span.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.ConfigureCouplingEnabled(System.Boolean[]@)
member.summary: Couples carrier settings to carrier #1. The coupled parameters are Carrier Power Present, Carrier Spacing, Measurement Noise Bandwidth, Method and Filter Alpha.
member.param: Coupling On or OFF

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.ConfigureIntegrationBandwidth(System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Specifies the Measurement Noise Bandwidth used to calculate the power in the carriers.
member.param: Bandwidth values

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.ConfigureMethod(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSAACPCarrierListMethodEnum[]@)
member.summary: Accesses the carrier configuration method settings.
member.param: Values for configuration method settings

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.ConfigurePowerPresent(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSAACPCarrierListPowerPresentEnum[]@)
member.summary: Configures the carriers for this measurement. It allows spaces to be inserted between carriers. Carriers with the power present parameter set to Yes are carriers, and those with the power present parameter set to No are spaces. Each carrier power present is set to Yes or No.
member.param: ACP Carrier List Power Channel.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.QueryCarrierMethod
member.summary: Queries the carrier configuration method settings.
member.returns: ON or OFF State of the carrier configuration method.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.QueryChannelSpacing
member.summary: Gets the width of the carrier spacing.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.QueryCouplingEnabled
member.summary: Queries the state of carrier settings couplings to carrier #1. The coupled parameters are Carrier Power Preset, Carrier Spacing, Measurement Noise Bandwidth, Method and Filter Alpha.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.QueryIntegrationBandwidth
member.summary: Queries the Measurement Noise Bandwidth used to calculate the power in the carriers.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.QueryMethod
member.summary: Queries the carrier configuration method settings.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.QueryPowerPresent
member.summary: The query for this parameter returns the current values for all of the carriers. If a carrier is defined as having no power present, the power displayed will be relative to the reference carrier, otherwise the absolute power will be displayed. If user changes the carrier power present to no and that carrier is currently configured as the reference carrier, the next carrier to the left (or the right if there are no carriers to the left) will be assigned as the reference carrier. This also applies to the scenario where there are only two carriers configured as having power present and you configure only one carrier to have no power present.
member.returns: Current values for all of the carriers.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.ConfigureAlphaValue(System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Sets the Alpha values for the filter used in the current carrier configuration.
member.param: Input range is from 0.01 to 1.0.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnSAACPCarrierList3.QueryAlphaValue
member.summary: Gets the Alpha values for the filter used in the current carrier configuration.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus2
member.summary: IAgXSAnStatus2 interface.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus2.Clear
member.summary: Clears all event registers and error queue. The enable registers are unaffected.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus2.ConfigureServiceRequest(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSRQReasonEnum)
member.summary: Clears all the enable registers. It then sets the appropriate transition filters and enable registers so when the specified event(s) occur(s) the instrument requests service. All other events are disabled from generating a service request. To detect a service request the client application must poll the status byte using the Status.SerialPoll method or Status.Register property and test the request service bit.
member.param: The defined values are powers of two, 1, 2, 4, etc. The client can OR several reasons together so multiple events can generate a service request.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus2.Preset
member.summary: Sets the SCPI defined enable registers and transition filters. It performs the actions specified by SCPI for the :STATus:PREset command, see SCPI Vol. 2: Command Reference, section 20.7.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus2.Register(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusRegisterEnum,Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEnum)
member.summary: Insturment status registers.
member.param: The status register to access. See StatusRegisterEnums for available registers.
The status sub register to access. See StatusSubRegisterEnums for available sub registers.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus2.get_Register(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusRegisterEnum,Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEnum)
member.summary: Insturment status registers.
member.param: The status register to access. See StatusRegisterEnums for available registers.
The status sub register to access. See StatusSubRegisterEnums for available sub registers.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus2.set_Register(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusRegisterEnum,Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEnum,System.Int32)
member.summary: Insturment status registers.
member.param: The status register to access. See StatusRegisterEnums for available registers.
The status sub register to access. See StatusSubRegisterEnums for available sub registers.
Insturment status registers.

member.name: P:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus2.SerialPoll
member.summary: Serial poll the instrument status byte.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus2.GetRegister(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusRegisterEnum)
member.summary: Gets the specified instrument status register. Reading an Event register clears it. Other registers are unaffected.
member.param: The status register to access. See StatusRegisterEnums for available registers.

member.name: M:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.IAgXSAnStatus2.SetRegister(Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusRegisterEnum,System.Int16)
member.summary: Sets the specified instrument status register. Condition and Event registers are read only and cannot be set.
member.param: The status register to access. See StatusRegisterEnums for available registers.
The value for the requested register.

member.summary: Turns the automatic alignment routines on and off. These are run continuously, in the background at the end of each sweep. When turned on, they are run once every 5 minutes, or if the ambient temperature changes by 3 degrees.

member.summary: Sets the spectrum analyzer to measure in decibels relative to 1 milliwatt.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnAmplitudeUnitsEnum.AgXSAnAmplitudeUnitsDBMV
member.summary: Sets the spectrum analyzer to measure in decibels relative to 1 millivolt.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnAmplitudeUnitsEnum.AgXSAnAmplitudeUnitsDBUV
member.summary: Sets the spectrum analyzer to measure in decibels relative to 1 microvolt.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum
member.summary: IVI SpecAn class-compliant values for Detector Type

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnDetectorTypeAverage
member.summary: Average value of samples taken within the bin for a dedicated point on the display.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnDetectorTypeMaxPeak
member.summary: Obtains the maximum video signal between the last display point and the present display point.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnDetectorTypeMinPeak
member.summary: Obtains the minimum video signal between the last display point and the present display point.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnDetectorTypeSample
member.summary: Pick one point within a bin.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnDetectorTypeRMS
member.summary: RMS value of samples taken within the bin for a dedicated point on the display.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnDetectorTypeNormal
member.summary: The Normal detector determines the peak of CW-like signals, and it yields alternating maximums and minimums of noise-like signals. This is also referred to as Rosenfell detection

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnDetectorTypeQuasiPeak
member.summary: The Quasi-Peak detector is a fast-rise, slow-fall detector used in making CISPR compliant EMI measurements.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEMIAverage
member.summary: The EMI-Average detector provides a standard means to ?smooth? the signal while still providing compliance to CISPR pulse response standards. It displays the average value of the amplitude envelope, rather than the average value of sample-detected amplitude, and uses an advanced algorithm to realize a lowpass filter that conforms to the latest CISPR standard.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnDetectorTypeRMSAverage
member.summary: RMS Average

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnDetectorTypeOff
member.summary: Turn off detector.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnVerticalScaleEnum
member.summary: IVI SpecAn class-compliant values for Vertical Scale

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnVerticalScaleEnum.AgXSAnVerticalScaleLinear
member.summary: When this value is selected, the vertical graticule divisions are linearly scaled with the reference level value at the top of the display and zero volts at the bottom. Each vertical division of the graticule represents one-tenth of the Reference Level.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnVerticalScaleEnum.AgXSAnVerticalScaleLogarithmic
member.summary: When this value is selected, the vertical graticule divisions are scaled in logarithmic units. The top line of the graticule is the Reference Level and uses the scaling per division Scale/Div to assign values to the other locations on the graticule.

member.summary: The spectrum analyzer is still acquiring data.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnAcquisitionStatusEnum.AgXSAnAcquisitionStatusComplete
member.summary: The spectrum analyzer has completed the acquisition.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnAcquisitionStatusEnum.AgXSAnAcquisitionStatusUnknown
member.summary: The spectrum analyzer cannot determine the status of the acquisition.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceTypeEnum
member.summary: IVI SpecAn class-compliant values for Trace Type

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceTypeEnum.AgXSAnTraceTypeClearWrite
member.summary: Sets the spectrum analyzer to clear previous sweep data off the display before performing a sweep. Subsequent sweeps may or may not clear the display first, but the data array at the end of the sweep is entirely new.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceTypeEnum.AgXSAnTraceTypeMaxHold
member.summary: Sets the spectrum analyzer to keep the data from either the previous data or the new sweep data, which ever is higher.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceTypeEnum.AgXSAnTraceTypeMinHold
member.summary: Sets the spectrum analyzer to keep the data from either the previous data or the new sweep data, which ever is lower.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceTypeEnum.AgXSAnTraceTypeVideoAverage
member.summary: Sets the spectrum analyzer to maintain a running average of the swept data.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceTypeEnum.AgXSAnTraceTypeView
member.summary: Disables acquisition into this trace but displays the existing trace data.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceTypeEnum.AgXSAnTraceTypeStore
member.summary: Disables acquisition and disables the display of the existing trace data.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerTypeEnum
member.summary: IVI SpecAn class-compliant values for Marker Type

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerTypeEnum.AgXSAnMarkerTypeNormal
member.summary: Regular marker used to make absolute measurements.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerTypeEnum.AgXSAnMarkerTypeDelta
member.summary: Marker used in conjunction with the reference marker to make relative measurements.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerTypeEnum.AgXSAnMarkerTypeOff
member.summary: A marker which is not in use.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerTypeEnum.AgXSAnMarkerTypeFixed
member.summary: A marker whose X Axis and Y Axis values may be directly or indirectly specified by user, but whose Y Axis value remains fixed, once specified, and does not follow the trace.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerSearchEnum.AgXSAnMarkerSearchMinimum
member.summary: Sets marker search for the minimum amplitude.

member.summary: PeakToPeak

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingEnum
member.summary: IVI SpecAn class-compliant values for Set Value from Marker

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingEnum.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingFrequencyCenter
member.summary: Sets the center frequency with the Active Marker frequency.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingEnum.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingFrequencySpan
member.summary: IF the Active Marker is a Delta Marker, this sets the frequency span with the Active Marker frequency and the center frequency at the midpoint between the Active Marker and its reference.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingEnum.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingFrequencyStart
member.summary: Sets the Frequency Start with the Active Marker frequency.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingEnum.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingFrequencyStop
member.summary: Sets the Frequency Stop with the Active Marker frequency.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingEnum.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingReferenceLevel
member.summary: Sets the Reference Level with the Active Marker amplitude.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingEnum.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingFrequencyCenterStep
member.summary: Sets the center frequency (CF) step size of the analyzer to the marker frequency, or in a delta-marker mode, to the frequency difference between the delta and reference markers.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingEnum.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingDeltaFrequencyCenter
member.summary: Sets the center frequency to the frequency difference between the selected marker and its reference marker. The marker is then changed to a Normal marker and placed at the center of span.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingEnum.AgXSAnInstrumentSettingDeltaFrequencySpan
member.summary: Sets the start and stop frequencies to the values of the delta markers.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnArmSourceDetectionEnum.AgXSAnArmSourceDetectionHigh

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnArmSourceDetectionEnum.AgXSAnArmSourceDetectionLow

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementMethodEnum
member.summary: Enumerations for desired method to measure ACP.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementMethodEnum.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementMethodIBW
member.summary: One sweep of the trace is taken, and the band power for each offset is computed. Depending on the status of the Meas Type results are displayed relative to the total power or the power spectral density. The display reflects either the current trace or a bar graph view.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementMethodEnum.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementMethodRBW
member.summary: The algorithm uses zero-span and an appropriate RBW setting to capture all of the power in the carrier channel and the offsets. The zero-span algorithm (RBW method) is slower than the IBW method, but greatly improves repeatability

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementMethodEnum.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementMethodIBWRange
member.summary: ACP Path is used to compute ACP when an ACP path is available. This method increases dynamic range, but increases measurement time as it limits the resolution bandwidth.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementMethodEnum.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementMethodFast
member.summary:
In SA mode with 3GPP WCDMA radio standard elected, this provides the same method as the Integration BW method, but with optimized for speed to measure W-CDMA signal.
In SA mode with CDMA2K radio standard selected, This provides faster measurement using FFT method with the limited parameter flexibility.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementTypeEnum.AgXSAnSAACPMeasurementTypeTotalPowerReference

member.summary: The measurement resets the average counter each time the specified number ofaverages is reached.

member.summary: Flattop filter.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnBandwidthShapeEnum.AgXSAnBandwidthShapeAutoSense

member.summary: The equivalent Impulse bandwidth of the filter, which is defined as the bandwidth of a rectangular filter with the same peak gain which would pass the same power for impulsive (narrow pulsed) signals.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnBandwidthTypeEnum.AgXSAnBandwidthTypeNoise
member.summary: The equivalent Noise bandwidth of the filter, which is defined as the bandwidth of a rectangular filter with the same peak gain which would pass the same power for noise signals.

member.summary: Integ BW-enables you to set the channel integration bandwidth.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSAACPCarrierListMethodEnum.AgXSAnSAACPCarrierListMethodRRCFiltered
member.summary: RRC Weight-selects Root Raised Cosine (RRC) filtering of the carriers and all adjacent channels. The alpha value (rolloff) for the filter is set to the value of the Filter Alpha parameter. This parameter is only available when W-CDMA 3GPP has been selected as the Radio Std from the Mode Setup menu.

member.summary: Operation Enable register (16 bit). Enable bits select whether an OperationEvent bit causes a register summary condition bit to become true in the StatusByte register.

member.summary: Read only Operation Event register (16 bit). Conditions which are part of the instrument's normal operation. Event bits capture changes in condition bits and remain set until cleared. Reading an event register clears it.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEnum
member.summary: Enumeration for the SubRegister parameter of the Register property in the Status interface.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEnum.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterCondition
member.summary: Conditions Register. Read only and not available with the Standard Event Status register. Condition bits represent the current instrument state. Reading a condition register does not change the value of the bits.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEnum.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterNegativeTransition
member.summary: Negative Transition Register. Can be read or written and available for Operation and Questionable registers only. If a bit is true, a negative transition of the corresponding condition bit causes the corresponding event bit to become true.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEnum.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterPositiveTransition
member.summary: Positive Transition Register. Can be read or written and available for Operation and Questionable registers only. If a bit is true, a positive transition of the corresponding condition bit causes the corresponding event bit to become true.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEnum.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEvent
member.summary: Event Reigster. Read only and not available with the Status Byte register. Event bits capture changes in condition bits. Reading an event register clears it.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEnum.AgXSAnStatusSubRegisterEnable
member.summary: Enable Register. Can be read or written and is available for all registers. Enable bits select whether an event bit causes a register summary bit, a kind of condition bit, to become true. Thus, an event can propagated to the status byte and finally to request service. Though the bits in the status byte are not technically event bits, the status byte enable register selects which bits in the status byte cause a service request.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSABurstPowerMeasurementMethodEnum
member.summary: Enumerations for desired method to measure BurstPower.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSABurstPowerMeasurementMethodEnum.AgXSAnSABurstPowerMeasurementMethodThreshold
member.summary: Used to capture a time record, and average only those points in the time record that exceed the user-specified threshold level. No attempt is made to position the burst, or to calculate/display burst widths. This can be used to measure continuous signals, or bursted signals where the Measured Burst Width algorithm is too restrictive.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSABurstPowerMeasurementMethodEnum.AgXSAnSABurstPowerMeasurementMethodBurstWidth
member.summary: Uses the threshold level to calculate the burst center, and average those points that lie within a user-specified burst width that is centered upon the burst.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSABurstPowerThresholdTypeEnum.AgXSAnSABurstPowerThresholdTypeAbsolute
member.summary: Threshold level is displayed in dB absolute value.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSABurstPowerThresholdTypeEnum.AgXSAnSABurstPowerThresholdTypeRelative
member.summary: Threshold level is displayed in dB, relative to the measured carrier.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSABurstPowerAverageTypeEnum.AgXSAnSABurstPowerAverageTypePower
member.summary: True power averaging that is equivalent to taking the RMS value of the voltage. It is the most accurate type of averaging.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSABurstPowerAverageTypeEnum.AgXSAnSABurstPowerAverageTypeLogPower
member.summary: Simulates the traditional spectrum analyzer type of averaging by averaging the log of the power.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSABurstPowerAverageTypeEnum.AgXSAnSABurstPowerAverageTypeMaximum
member.summary: The maximum values are retained during the averaging cycle.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSABurstPowerAverageTypeEnum.AgXSAnSABurstPowerAverageTypeMinimum
member.summary: The minimum values are retained during the averaging cycle.

member.summary: From the center of the carrier closest to the adjacent channel to the edge of the closest adjacent channe's Offset Integ BW

member.summary: From Center Frequency - Carrier Spacing / 2 (for lower offset), Center Frequency + Carrier Spacing / 2 (for upper offset) of the carrier closest to the adjacent channel's to the center of the adjacent channel's Offset Integ BW

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionsMeasurementTypeEnum
member.summary: Enumerations for the reference used for the Spurious Emissions measurement.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionsMeasurementTypeEnum.AgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionsMeasurementTypeExamine
member.summary:
Single: 1) No Spurs found : - All active ranges are measured. On completion the measurement is set to the idle state. 2) Spurs Found : - All active ranges are measured and the spurs found reported. On completion the measurement is set to the idle state and the trace containing the worst spur restored. A marker is also added which is set to the frequency of the worst spur.
Continuous: 1) No Spurs Found : - All active ranges are measured. On completion the SA remains set to last range checked with an active trace . 2) Spurs Found : - All active ranges are measured and the spurs found reported. On completion the SA is set to the range containing the worst spur found and continually sweeps this range. A marker is also added which is set to the frequency of the worst spur.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionsMeasurementTypeEnum.AgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionsMeasurementTypeFull
member.summary:
Single: 1) No Spurs found : - All active ranges are measured. On completion the measurement is set to the idle state. 2) Spurs Found : - All active ranges are measured and spurs found reported. On completion the measurement is set to the idle state, displaying the trace of the last active range.
Continuous: 1) No Spurs Found : -Measurement continually cycles through all active ranges. 2) Spurs Found : - All active ranges are measured and spurs found reported. On each cycle of the active ranges the spurs found are reset.This ensures any remote queries retrieve the trace data that matches the currently displayed results.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionReportModeEnum

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionReportModeEnum.AgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionReportModeAll
member.summary: Reports all spurs detected by Peak Threshold and Peak Excursion.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionReportModeEnum.AgXSAnSASpuriousEmissionReportModeLimitTest
member.summary: Reports only spurs above the limit line. Any spurs reported will cause the measurement to fail.

member.summary: When using an external reference with inferior phase noise performance, the user can set that bandwidth to narrow (15 Hz). In these relationships, inferior and superior phase noise are with respect to ?134 dBc/Hz at 30 Hz offset from a 10 MHz reference

member.summary: Enumerations for microwave preselector paths.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnPreselectorMicroWavePathEnum.AgXSAnPreselectorMicroWavePathStandard
member.summary: This path gives the best remote-control throughput, minimizes acoustic noise from switching and minimizes the risk of wear in the hardware switches, particularly in remote test scenarios where both low band and high band setups will follow in rapid succession.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnPreselectorMicroWavePathEnum.AgXSAnPreselectorMicroWavePathLowNoise
member.summary: Gives a lower noise floor under some circumstances, particularly when operating in the 21?26.5 GHz region.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnPreselectorMicroWavePathEnum.AgXSAnPreselectorMicroWavePathByPass
member.summary: Pre-selector bypass provides an unpreselected input mixer path for certain X-Series signal analyzers with frequency ranges above 3.6 GHz. This signal path allows a wider bandwidth and less amplitude variability, which is an advantage when doing modulation analysis and broadband signal analysis.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerFunctionEnum
member.summary: Enumerations for marker function types.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerFunctionEnum.AgXSAnMarkerFunctionBandPower
member.summary: Turns on the Band/Interval Power function for the selected marker.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerFunctionEnum.AgXSAnMarkerFunctionNoise
member.summary: Turns on the Marker Noise function for the selected marker, making it a noise marker.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerFunctionEnum.AgXSAnMarkerFunctionOff
member.summary: Turns off the marker function. Makes the marker a normal marker.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnMarkerFunctionEnum.AgXSAnMarkerFunctionBandDensity
member.summary:
Turns on the Band/Interval Power function for the selected marker. If the selected marker is off it is turned on in Normal marker and located at the center of the screen.
On frequency domain traces, the average density across a band is the total band power divided by the bandwidth over which it is measured.
On time domain traces, interval density is the average power in the interval divided by the noise bandwidth of the RBW of the trace.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodEnum
member.summary: Enumerations for method for compressing trace data.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodEnum.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodBlock
member.summary: Returns all the data points from the region of the trace data that users specify.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodEnum.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodCfit
member.summary: Curve fit - applies curve fitting routines to the data. Parameters soffset and length are required to define the data that user wants.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodEnum.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodMaximum
member.summary: Returns the maximum data point (x,y pair) for the specified region(s) of trace data.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodEnum.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodMean
member.summary: Returns a single value that is the arithmetic mean of the data point values (in dB/ dBm) for the specified region(s) of trace data.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodEnum.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodMinimum
member.summary: Returns the minimum data point (x,y pair) for the specified region(s) of trace data.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodEnum.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodSample
member.summary: Returns the first data value (x,y pair) for the specified region(s) of trace data.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodEnum.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodRMS
member.summary: Returns a single value that is the average power on a root-mean-squared voltage scale (arithmetic rms) of the data point values for the specified region(s) of trace data.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodEnum.AgXSAnTraceCompressMethodDeviation
member.summary: Returns a single value that is the arithmetic standard deviation for the data point values for the specified region(s) of trace data.

member.summary: Enumerations for mathematical function to be performed on trace data.

member.summary: Turns off Trace Math.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceMathFunctionEnum.AgXSAnTraceMathFunctionPowerDifference
member.summary: Calculates a power difference between the First Trace operand and the Second Trace operand and puts the result in the destination trace.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceMathFunctionEnum.AgXSAnTraceMathFunctionPowerSum
member.summary: Calculates a power sum between the First Trace operand and the Second Trace operand and puts the result in the destination trace.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceMathFunctionEnum.AgXSAnTraceMathFunctionLogOffset
member.summary: Calculates a log offset from the First Trace operand and puts the result in the destination trace.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnTraceMathFunctionEnum.AgXSAnTraceMathFunctionLogDifference
member.summary: Offsets the difference between the First Trace operand and the Second Trace operand by a reference and puts the result in the destination trace.

member.name: T:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeEnum
member.summary: Enumerations for type of detector for list sweep measurements.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeLogAverage
member.summary: Average detector. Average detected on the log scale.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeVoltageAverage
member.summary: Average detector. Average detected on the voltage scale.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeRMSAverage
member.summary: Average detector. Average detected on the power scale.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeMinPeak
member.summary: Negative peak detector.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeMaxPeak
member.summary: Positive peak detector.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeSample
member.summary: Sample detector.

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeAveragePeak
member.summary: Peak- Average detector. Allows the simultaneous measurement and two-point reporting of the results of the positive peak and the average detector (voltage scale).

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeRMSPeak
member.summary: Peak- rms detector. Allows the simultaneous measurement and two-point reporting of the results of the positive peak and the average detector (rms scale).

member.name: F:Agilent.AgXSAn.Interop.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeEnum.AgXSAnListDetectorTypeDualAverage
member.summary: Allows two-point reporting of simultaneously made measurements. With this detector, one result (the former) is average detected on the power (rms) scale, and one is average detected on the voltage scale.
